adrFormatAddress: 285 West End Avenue suite y2, New York, NY 10023, USA

originalText.text: I cannot speak more highly about my experiences with Central Park Midwifery. I worked with them through both of my pregnancies. I had a very positive experience the my first pregnancy, but when I got pregnant a second time I thought I would try another, closer practitioner. What can i say but you don't know what you've got till it's gone... the level of communication and personal connection at CPMW is just unparalleled. So after a couple of months I switched back and felt an immediate sense of relief. I just wish this level of care existed outside of the pregnancy and labor in normal day to day healthcare!

originalText.text:
I cannot find sufficient words to describe how incredible and wonderful the Central Park Midwifery team is.

I had had a challenging time conceiving and terrible experiences with OBs before I came to them. I wanted a hospital birth, but with a care team that cared about me and my family and took the time to listen/communicate and answer my hundreds of questions. I got that and so much more!

For the months leading up to the birth they always took the time to answer any questions I had, gave great recommendations around self-care and preparations, and really put me at ease. I looked forward to every appointment! When I expressed an interest to wait as long as possible before going in for induction, they heard me and provided as many natural options to encourage contractions as possible and were so encouraging!
My son's birth was challenging, but I only have fond memories thanks to Jenna's presence and guidance. I felt I had agency at every single step and that she was on *my* side not the hospital's.

Their support after the birth was constant and caring with frequent check-ins and empathetic listening. I knew I could reach out anytime and get a thorough and quick response. There was never any judgement no matter how wild or gross I thought my question was!

I now go to them for my standard gynecological check-ups and needs (including IUD insertion) and it's such a pleasure to see them every time.

originalText.text:
Central Park Midwifery is an absolutely wonderful midwifery practice.  The support and care Christina, Jenna and Elaine provided me in my pregnancies is the best I have ever encountered (and I have had experience with two other Manhattan-based hospital midwifery groups, both of which were really good but unfortunately have been disbanded). I moved to Central Park Midwifery somewhat late into my second pregnancy when the hospital where I was planning to deliver stopped offering midwifery-led care.  I then subsequently had my third baby with the support of Central Park Midwifery.

Elaine, Christina and Jenna took so much time with me at each appointment, answering all of my questions and making sure I was supported and nurtured.  I wasn’t a first time parent so I probably didn’t have the same amount of questions or need for information as some other birthing people but I did have particular concerns and issues that I wanted to discuss in light of my prior birthing experiences.  Each of Christina, Jenna and Elaine tailored their care and our discussions to exactly my circumstances: I always felt like they were responding precisely to my unique needs and wants and were invested in my pregnancy and birth experience.  They gave me really practical steps for things I could do to increase the likelihood of having natural births in a hospital setting and minimise the chance that circumstances would arise needing medical intervention (which was something I wanted to avoid, if possible).  They also gave me thoughtful, effective guidance throughout the postpartum experience to ensure my physical recovery and mental health.

All of my births were really empowering experiences and I look back on each of them so fondly.  I know it was the guidance and care of Central Park Midwifery that contributed to the memories of each of my births being so positive.  Christina was with me when I birthed my second child and she was an absolute superhero: she provided me with guidance, direction and calm in turn as I needed it and respected and advocated for my wishes at every step (beyond what I had experienced before).  At first I was disappointed that Christina couldn’t also be with me for the birth of my third child (Elaine was on shift when I went into labor) but I immediately realised that Elaine was the perfect partner for that birth journey.  That particular birth had some dramatics but Elaine kept absolutely cool (and kept us cool), kept me informed and together we came up with new and revised plans as things changed.  Her presence in the delivery room was so very helpful and her encouragement got me out of my head and focused my belief in myself even when my strength was waning.  I honestly don’t think I would have been able to have the birth experiences I had if it wasn’t for Central Park Midwifery and their incredible care.

originalText.text: Central Park Midwifery is exactly the type of healthcare I'd been searching years for, but wasn't sure actually existed. From the start, they were welcoming and took such good care of me throughout my pregnancies. When my first one ended in a miscarriage, the care, support, kindness, and check-ins they provided were truly unmatched - and when I got pregnant again, they not only took care of me, but celebrated with me. They answered questions, were patient, and were so knowledgable. They made sure that I was fully informed on every decision that I had to make, helped me develop intuition about my body, and helped me make the best choices for myself and my baby. Although my birth experience ended in an unplanned C-Section, Elaine never left my side for a second and was such a support for both myself and my husband. And their care didn't stop postpartum - Christina visited me on the maternity floor, I received check-ins from everyone, and just felt so supported during this period of adjustment. We can't wait to come back to CPM for our future pregnancies. Thank you endlessly Jenna, Christina, and Elaine - you showed me a level of compassion that I didn't know existed in medicine. You are appreciated more than you know!!!

You are appreciated more than you know!!!

originalText.text:
When my wife came to me and told me that she wanted to establish care with Central Park Midwifery, she thought I would be hesitant. She was not wrong – I did not fully understand what a midwifery could offer that an OB could not. Ultimately, I wanted to make sure my wife was comfortable, secure, and confident in her birthing team, so I agreed. Entrusting Central Park Midwifery was the best decision we could have made for my wife, my child, and myself.

Before our most recent childbearing experience, my wife and I suffered a miscarriage. It was early in the pregnancy, but it did not minimize the pain that we felt and still continue to feel. The one shining light of that experience was that Elaine, Jenna, and Christina were there for us every step of the way. When we were fortunate enough to get pregnant again, they were always cognoscente of what we had been through and understood when we had extra concerns or worries. As the pregnancy progressed, I was constantly amazed at the level of care and communication that the midwives had directly with my wife.

When we finally reached the end of the pregnancy, no one could prepare us for what we went through. Throughout the pregnancy, my wife constantly communicated that she was willing to do whatever was necessary to make sure our baby was delivered safely. The only thing she requested was that I would be by her side throughout. After 13 hours of labor, everything was progressing nicely. Then Elaine noticed that our baby’s heartbeat was dropping. While she was explaining this to us, and possible reasons as to why, the rest of the hospital staff was preparing my wife for an emergency C-Section. No one can prepare you for seeing that many hospital staffers rushing to your wife’s bedside. Elaine calmly explained what was happening and what was to happen next. She explained that my wife had to be brought to the operating room so that they could prepare her for the surgery. Ultimately, I would not be allowed in while this was happening. I was devastated. At the same time, they asked me to step outside the hospital room so that they could move her, and a flood of emotion came over me. I was brought to tears. I could not adhere to the one request that my wife asked of me in her birth preferences. Elaine immediately noticed my fear and sadness (even through masking!). She told me to take a few deep breaths and know that the doctors were just prepping my wife, and that I’d be able to be by her side when our baby came into the world. While I just briefly described how Elaine helped me, words could never do enough justice to fully articulate how helpful and calming she was in what were the most traumatic minutes of my life.

I cannot thank Central Park Midwifery enough for all their help, love, and support they showed my wife, myself, and our baby! He is doing incredible and is the absolute light of our lives! If any prospective fathers/partners are hesitant about midwiferies and would like to talk to me, I am happy to!
